sections.text: Once wudu’ has been properly made, one proceeds to pray salah, which is composed of units called rak‘ahs. Each rak‘ah follows the same sequence of movements and recitations:

items: Standing (Qiyam) – Begin in an upright position.
Takbir – Say “Allahu akbar” to enter the prayer.
Recitation (Qira’ah) – Recite Surat al‑Fatihah, then a portion of the Qur’an.
Tashahhud (in final rak‘ah) – Sit and recite the testimony before concluding.

sections.text: To understand the steps of the salah it is important to understand that the prayer is made up of rak‘ahs, or units of prayer. Every rak‘ah has the same basic steps within it.

items: There will be a part when you are standing
A part when you recite from the Qur’an
A part when you bow down
A part where you prostrate (make sujud)
Fajr (2 rak‘ah): Both rak‘ahs recited aloud—Fatihah + another surah.
Dhuhr (4 rak‘ah): All silent—Rakah 1–2: Fatihah + another surah; Rakah 3–4: Fatihah only.
Maghrib (3 rak‘ah): Rakah 1–2 aloud: Fatihah + another surah; Rakah 3 silent: Fatihah only.
‘Isha’ (4 rak‘ah): Rakah 1–2 aloud; Rakah 3–4 silent (same pattern as Maghrib).

sections.text: Let us break down how each rak‘ah of the salah is performed, step by step.
We first began the prayer by making an intention from the heart to pray to Allah. As soon as you begin, your entire focus should be on the prayer itself and nothing else.

Raise your hands to your ears and say “Allahu Akbar”.

The moment you say “Allahu Akbar” the prayer officially begins. From this point forward you should focus wholeheartedly on the prayer and ignore all distractions.

Fun Fact: In Arabic, “Allahu Akbar” literally means “Allah is Greater,” reminding you in prayer that Allah is greater than all other thoughts and actions.

Lower your hands and place them over your navel. Your right hand should be placed over your left hand. Keep your eyes focused on the ground in front of you. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that while praying your eyes should always look to where you will prostrate.

formatted_text.text: Lower your hands and place them over your navel. Your right hand should be placed over your left hand. Keep your eyes focused on the ground in front of you. Prophet Muhammad (
) said that while praying your eyes should always look to where you will prostrate.

sections.text: Recite the opening chapter of the Qur’an, “Surah Al‑Fatihah.” After reciting Surah Al‑Fatihah, you may recite another chapter from the Qur’an. At a minimum you must recite Surah Al‑Fatihah in every rak‘ah of prayer.

Bow down (Ruku‘). As you are bowing, say “Allahu Akbar.” Keep your back straight, hands on your knees, and eyes on the ground where you will prostrate. In this position say three times: “Subhana Rabi al‑‘Azim” (“How perfect is my Lord, the Magnificent”).

Return to standing. As you rise from Ruku‘, raise your hands to your ears and say “Sami'a Allahu liman hamidah” (“Allah hears those who praise Him”). Then lower your hands to your waist and say “Rabbana wa laka al‑hamd” (“Our Lord, to You is all praise”).

Go down to prostrate (Sujud). As you move into this position say “Allahu Akbar,” and ensure your forehead, nose, palms, knees, and toes touch the ground. While in Sujud say three times: “Subhana Rabi al‑‘Ala” (“How perfect is my Lord, the Most High”).

Rise from Sujud and sit on your left leg (Tashahhud position). Say “Allahu Akbar.” Place your hands on your knees. It is recommended to ask Allah for forgiveness: “Rabbigh‑fir li” (“O my Lord, forgive me”).
Return to Sujud (second prostration) and say “Allahu Akbar.” While in Sujud say three times: “Subhana Rabi al‑‘Ala.”
Arise from the second Sujud to standing, saying “Allahu Akbar.” Congratulations—you have completed one full rak‘ah! After two rak‘ahs you will sit for Tashahhud instead of standing.

Perform the Tashahhud at the end of every two rak‘ahs. Sit on your legs, raise your right index finger, and say:

“At‑Tahiyyatu li‑Llahi wa‑s‑Salawatu wa‑t‑Tayyibatu
As‑Salamu 'alayka ayyuhan‑nabiyyu wa rahmatu Llahi wa barakatuh
As‑Salamu 'alayna wa 'ala 'ibadillahi s‑salihin
Ash‑hadu alla ilaha illallah wa ash‑hadu anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa rasuluh”

In the last rak‘ah, after sitting for Tashahhud, add the Salawat:

“Allahumma salli 'ala Muhammadin wa 'ala ali Muhammad
Kama sallayta 'ala Ibrahima wa 'ala ali Ibrahim
Innaka Hamidun Majid
Wa barik 'ala Muhammadin wa 'ala ali Muhammad
Kama barakta 'ala Ibrahima wa 'ala ali Ibrahim
Innaka Hamidun Majid”

Then conclude the prayer with Taslim:

Turn your head to the right and say “Assalamu 'alaykum wa rahmatu Llah”.
Turn your head to the left and repeat “Assalamu 'alaykum wa rahmatu Llah”.

items: Units (Rak‘ahs): Each salah consists of 2, 3, or 4 rak‘ahs, depending on the prayer.
Core steps per rak‘ah: Standing → Takbir → Recitation → Ruku‘ → Sujud → (Second Sujud) → (If final rak‘ah, Tashahhud + Salawat + Taslim).
Final Tashahhud: In the last rak‘ah you sit for Tashahhud, send blessings (Salawat), then conclude with Taslim to both sides.
Combining rak‘ahs: Simply repeat the core sequence the required number of times, observing which rak‘ahs are recited aloud or silently as per each prayer’s ruling.
